did.abstract: The Long Islander clippings collection contains an assortment of clippings from the Long Islander newspaper documenting primarily deaths and marriages but also sundry other topics. The Long Islander was founded in 1838 by the poet Walt Whitman, and as of 2024, it continues to publish as a weekly newspaper covering the town of Huntington, Long Island, New York.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The collection was formally accessioned in 1985.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The clippings are arranged into envelopes by year and sometimes by topic.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Long Islander was founded in 1838 by the poet Walt Whitman, and as of 2024, it continues to publish as a weekly newspaper covering the town of Huntington, Long Island, New York.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Islander clippings collection, 1985.040, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level by Matthew Gorham on August 19, 2011. Rehoused by John Zarrillo in December 2015. Finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in July 2024. At that time, preservation photocopies were created of some clippings, and one September 1866 clipping about the Long Island Historical Society was discarded after photocopying due to its poor condition.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: CBH holds issues of the Long Islander on microfilm from 1839-1849, 1858-1862, and 1878-1882.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Long Islander clippings collection contains an assortment of clippings from the Long Islander newspaper documenting primarily deaths and marriages but also sundry other topics, including the Long Island Historical Society (now the Center for Brooklyn History).

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.
